result.execSummary:
The defendant Alisha M Danning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alisha M Danning is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alisha M Danning was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.  Sentence credit for 2 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs/surcharge.   Remainder of costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No violent contact with any family members listed in the criminal complaint.
Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions consecutive - STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alisha M Danning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Steinle makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count 2
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
75 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 2 days).  Concurrent.  
Term of Probation: 1 Yeas
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with any family members listed in the criminal complaint.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent.  
Condition Time: 5 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS consecutive- STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $343.00 bail to be applied from Case #15CF370
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 bail to be applied from Case #15CF370, remainder to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Alisha M Danning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Court shedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Alisha M Danning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Bryan C. Bayer and Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinle makes statements.  Parties advise this case is resolved but requests a plea hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant Alisha M Danning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any family members.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Alisha M Danning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
